Particle Density: Point and Wave
<!-- \index{Particle} -->

Particles N $\equiv$ Natural Oscillations\footnote{Eingenschwingungen, intrinsic} of blackbody within a range of frequency spectrum\footnote{Frequenzintervall} $(\nu,\nu+d\nu)$ $\equiv$ 
<!-- \index{ocscillation, self} -->
Vibration Modes $\equiv$ Points $\equiv$ exactly one of each possible wavevectors $\vec{k}$
<!-- \footnote{Schwingungsmoden} \index{Point particle} \index{Wavevector} \index{Mode} -->

$a \equiv$ particle size (radius, extension) of each individual particle $i = \left[1,N\right]$

$\frac{\pi}{a} =$ Grid Constant $\equiv$ next point distance between those N points 
<!-- \index{Grid Constant} -->

$0 \neq m_i = \frac{2a}{\lambda_i} \in \mathbb{N}_+ \qquad \lambda = \frac{c}{\nu} = \frac{\omega}{k} \frac{1}{\nu}$

$|\vec{k}| = k = \frac{\pi}{a} \sqrt{ \sum m_i^2 } = \frac{\omega}{c} = \frac{2\pi\nu}{c} = \frac{2\pi}{\lambda} \equiv$ Sphere Radius (containing the grid of particles inside) 
<!-- \index{Sphere Radius} -->

$\sum m_i^2 \gg 1 \iff k \gg \frac{\pi}{a} \iff \lambda \ll 2a$: N in blackbody independent of geometrical form

$$
N = 
\frac{1}{3} \frac{1}{2\pi^2} \left( a \frac{\omega}{c} \right)^3 = 
\frac{1}{3} 2^2\pi \left( a \frac{\nu}{c} \right)^3 = 
\frac{4\pi}{3} \left( \frac{a}{\lambda} \right)^3
$$

$$
N(\omega) = 
\frac{1}{3} \frac{1}{\pi^2} \left( \frac{\omega \cdot a}{c} \right)^3
$$

$$
N(\nu) = 
\frac{1}{3} \cdot 2^2 \cdot 2\pi \left( \frac{\nu \cdot a}{c} \right)^3
$$


Density: 
<!-- \index{Density} -->

$$
n = \frac{N}{V} = \frac{N}{A^3} = 
\frac{8\pi}{3} \left( \frac{\nu}{c} \right)^3 = 
\frac{1}{3} \pi \left( \frac{2}{\lambda} \right)^3
$$

$$
n_{\nu} = 
\frac{dn}{d\nu} = 
8\pi \frac{\nu^2}{c^3} = 
3 \frac{n}{\nu} 
$$

$$
n_{\lambda} = 
- \frac{dn}{d\lambda} = 
8\pi \frac{1}{\lambda^4} = 
3 \frac{n}{\lambda}
$$
